review for  dota 2 review by  weebj dota 2 is the remake of a moba mod that was applied to warcraft 3 frozen throne it is a mindchallenging teamplay game that require skills and teamwork most of my experience from this game is positive i prefer to play carry or initiator as i have played alot of hours on smurf accounts i have a bit of experience on the ranked and experienced side of the game the thing that bothers me with ranked match making is that after your calibrating games you either get into the best mmr possible or the worst you could ever imagine anyways the best thing with dota is that it always evolves which means that updates and patches are frequently released to balance the game and the players experience there are also cosmetic items that are often added with the patch updates gameplay consists of different roles in a 5man team either you start in the radiant or dire team support offlane mid and carry are a few roles that i recommend you having in almost every dota game the game itself is about destroying the enemy teams ancient which is a giant building located abovebelow your spawn the easiest tactic to making you and your team win the match is to make sure your carry gets farm kills and hisher core items this is crucial because if your carry cant farm or has bad farm it will cripple your team without a good carry your team will succumb to the enemies carry which hopefully in their favor has farmed better or has already completed hisher core items the offlane role is all about going alone to get experience in the lane which is located at the top lane on both sides of the team this will gain your offlaner early levels and the hero of choice should always have an escapeinvisibility ability in hisher ability pool having an escape mechanism will keep himher from panicking and boosting their selfconfidence of commiting to their own team and gameplay the midlaner is often a ranged hero but its normal with melee heroes or a high damage nuker that is going alone on the middle lane the midlaner will be facing a hero of the enemys choice that will participate in trying to take control of the midlane from you popular mid heroes are storm spirit ember spirit sniper dragon knight lina pudge death prophet night stalker huskar necrophos and more heroes like necrophos death prophet storm spirit and lina are nukers which have lowcooldown highdamaging spells in their ability pool these heroes are the easiest heroes of taking control in the midlane by using your highdamage lowcooldown spells the enemy will often retreat from the midlane to seek health and mana regen in their fountain the midlaner also plays an important role in the ganking scene pudge storm spirit huskar sniper ember spirit dragon knight and lina are gankers which can sneak away from the midlane to other lanes where they can help the other laners to gain kills which will result in an experience and gold boost to your carryofflaner the midlaner should also get a bottle which they can store important runes in runes are special abilities that spawn in form of orbs in the bottom and top of the river in small areas of light these runes have abilities such as haste max movement speed regeneration fully regenerates your hp and mana invisibility makes you invisibile for some time and bounty runes which gives you experience and gold runes spawn every 2 minutes of the game and theres a 100 percent chance one of them will be a bounty rune the carry will often going to lane on the safe lane which on the radiant side is bot lane and the top lane on the dire side the carry should always have a support with himher which is a hero that is going to support the carry through the lanephase the carry needs last hits on creeps enemy units that spawn every 30th second with those last hits he will gain gold ranging from 3849 gold per last hit the carry is a crucial role and is needed to play with ease and care mistakes usually result in a permanent mark for your team if your carry has succeeded with his farming he is often going to finish his core items in the lategame being a support is also a crucial role in the game as the support is standing for all the wards and the courier in the game a ward is an item that gives vision of an area where it was placed if the ward was placed on a higher ground hilltop or all seeying eyespots it will gain unobstructed vision which is also a great thing for your team as you can see the enemy advance or preparing for a gank the supports ability pool often consists of a stundisable which is casted upon the enemy the enemy will then be disabled and cannot movecast spells during the disable duration this is an easy way to set up ganks and kills for your carry supports are very squishy but masters in the teamfights no crucial items is needed for a support but i recommend force staff blink dagger wards tranquil bootsarcane boots pipe of insight and mekansm dota is a game that once again requires teamplay tactics and good planning always look up a guide on how to play the game correctly or how to play the current hero you are playing it always helps pros  game never gets boring even though you loose a match you always get that great sense of today im gonna win this match  you can play with your friends in parties up to five  combinations of hero picks and playstyle is unending cons  russians  feeders  supports without any wards  carry players that cant carry  the feeling of a lost game when it comes to russians the only thing i hate with them is that they believe that everyone in their game speaks russian if you dont speak russian you are a gamburger which they are referring to you as an american even though you are playing on eu west etc they queue on all of the servers their language preference is all of the languages chinese english russian etc they barely listen to their teammates they believe they are superior to everyone else in the game and if they dont get what they want they will usually feed or get extremely mad at everyone a tip from me always be nice never say a bad word if someone is flaming mute them keep playing to help your team and remember to never flame back it will usually result in loss of a match and people are most likely not to listen to flamers and will just mute you which results you in being isolated from all communication with your team developer  valve publisher  valve genre  action free to play strategy released on steam on 9 jun 2013 i recommend dota 2 because it is an addictive and fun game to fuel your moba needs

i think its about damn time i wrote a review about my favourite game ever 1600 hours in it and here it is this game is dope as hell never have i spent close to this amount of time in a game before brings back some good memories of warcraft 3 and i feel that i have a special connection to this game im sure anyone else who has tried any of the games in the warcraft series would have the same nostalgic feeling that i too have when i play the game has a really unique hero collection in which none are op and every hero counters and gets countered by another hero making the game much more fair furthermore all the characters are free and the only thing you can buy is sets and items to make your hero look much cooler purchases dont affect the actual heros stats thus the game is very fair as compared to other games that i know{yes im talking about lolthe name says it all the game is a joke p} i definitely recommend this game to anyone who is perseverant and doesnt quit after getting rekt by riki haha dota is all about practice and youll make it there eventually i know the dota community can sometimes be very rude and harsh but instead of looking your teammates comments about you as insults learn to take it as advice that you can follow in the future unless hes just a raging kid in which case you just mute him i hope this review will encourage potential dota players to try the best game ever created and create your own legacy 3

dota 2 like any game has pros and cons pros > free to play not pay to win > the graphics are great > complex gameplay and mechanics > a lot of characters to to choose from > your heroes are customizeable cosmetical items > dota 2 has a thriving international competitive scene > never gets boring > constant updates cons > constant updates > peole only seem to play the same try hard heroes every game > dota 2 has a bad community not everyone but most of the community is really unsupportive and not beginnerfriendly > bad matchmaking you get matchmade with players who are either too inexperienced for your level or have too much experience > unbalanced characters some of these try hard heroes are just too over powered and others very weak dota 2 is a game of strategy skill and teamwork do not forget teamwork far superior to any free 2 play game i have tried so far i recomend it but try not to choose the same try hard heroes over and over then think you are good at dota

great game really enjoyable the character selection is fantastic they still add in new heroes from time to time to keep it lively they keep it updated to keep it lively as well great selection of community made skins weapons etc alongside a fun selection of voiceovers that you can choose as the announcer if you dont like buying dlc or addon content they allow it to be shared in games so it eleminates the hassle of never being able to see it in action and for me eleminates me having to ever buy the content  its one of the top mobas out there only drawback would be the community that encompasses it sometimes its not so bad depending on the group you get matched with obviously the way to get around this problem is to play with a bunch of friends you know so you wont ever get grouped up with others nevertheless the learning curve on the game can be harsh as can the general rules of the game i prefer the fact that it is punishing if you get killed frequentlyon a regular basis

i hate competitive games especially mobas and starcraft this one however managed to suck me in with vs bots game mode and cosmetic items store im still not sure how or why it happened but i do enjoy playing dota and sometimes i even play vs people even though it makes me want to cry or yell in rage there are few major issues with dota 2 at the moment 1 absence of communication between developers and players dev forums seem to exist only for players since thousands of bugs especially cosmetic ones and suggestions simply remain ignored 2 infrequent content updates and lack of features they couldve at least allowed us to play game modes from different events to diversify gameplay or added new maps instead they keep focusing on adding new cosmetic items 9 out of 10 updates only include hats game folder keeps growing but nothing changes gameplaywise they even stopped adding new bots to my favourite game mode 3 constant server side issues which they cant fix there are issues with downloading replays reconnecting to games watching matches searching for games and even finishing matches without somebody getting crashes or disconnects 4 a lot of racism swearing and general anger towards other players especially russians report system is completely inadequate and doesnt help at all i would recommend dota 2 because its cute and wellthought game with amazing voiceovers and excellent replayability i do advise however against spending money in their store since once your start you cannot stop this is probably how drug addiction works  they pull you in with free stuff and then you just want to complete a set buy new items because of the modified effects gamble for a chance to get some common item which would later cost hundreds of dollars valve deliberately removes some items to drive up prices find some unusual courier which could easily compensate all of your spendings or plunge yourself into poverty if you get unlucky with chests

dota 2 is a multiplayer online battle arena game from valve dota 2 is the next installment from the previous game or mods dota dota 2 has the same gameplay as dota you pick your heroes and then battle them in one map against another player in the arena as you kill and progress you will get coins and the use them to buy items to enhance your heroes on your current battle in the arena you need to pick the right items each time you play as it will decide you will win the game or not dota 2 introduce item drops each time you finish a match online there are many items in dota 2 that can enhance your favourite heroes looks each item has rarity the more rare the items the more expensive it will become most items can be sold in the steam marketplace dota 2 has far improved graphics from the previous game heroes are even more detailed and the arena has better view all heroes ability effects are also improved even the ui is better dota 2 has many tournaments that you can participate the biggest is the international dota 2 tournament most tournaments can reward players with some rare items just by watching the tournaments dota 2 is the best moba game yet i recommend this rating 910

funny game competitive every match is different and best support and innovation ive seen in a long time in a game and all this for free yeah i could say we are in front of the best moba game in the market but i can say some things that are not that great though about dota 2 at the end of this review its true that this game is bringing the best innovation ive seen in a long time in a videogame this industry is a bit stuck in making money giving just enough for the clients and players and then adding more to pay via dlcs some times they even launch a game that is a beta at 50 bucks price or higher when i talk about innovation i mean for example about the best support for watching games replays and tournaments but the bad side of this is that if you want to watch tournament games all of them requires a ticket to be bought except the only free yearly tournament that is the international being the only exception also the visual customization of the heroes is insane you can customize by separated parts helm shoulders arms body legs weapon just like in a mmo and even some animations or skills and you can trade all of your items in the market or with friends the great thing about this game compared to others like league of legends is that paying money does not affect to gameplay just visuals in league of legends paying money gave you the advantage of having more and better runes and more rune pages for example giving you a little advantage in a competitive scenario also you need to buy some heroescharacters or you cant play all of them when you feel the need to even when you can buy those things without money its almost impossible to get everything without paying even if you play a lot big limitations to competitive gameplay in dota 2 there is no restriction you play every hero you play with every skill also there is a lot of other great things like user skill and item builds and guides that you can select and use ingame and rate up or down you can customize your own for each hero and even the announcer if you have one among other things then what is the bad side of dota 2 first of it you always need a team in order to play or get some fun solo matchmaking is not just bad its horrible no matter how good you are and how long youve been playing this game you will end up with drunk players idiots trolls bored players who are not focused on the game and this is on both sides of the game in your team or in the other report system doesnt work at all maybe just a bit for excessive cases and even if you play with friends in a full team you wont find balanced games the common issue here is either you roflstomp the other team or they roflstomp yours even if you played great of course playing with a full party of friends can decrease the chances this happens but even with that playing a good balanced funny and competitive game will be hard this said they need to implement some kind of public ranking system in order to maybe avoid that a little and then maybe the things could become really better but overall this is a great game with a very good support from their developers constantly adding content and not just focusing on getting your money something rare to find nowadays in the industry

a thoroughly intricate game with massive emphasis put on both skills and knowledge it is not recommended for casual gamers or for those seeking for some easy enjoyment with over a hundred heroes with their own unique abilities and ways to specifically build and play said heroes as well as their weaknesses and strengths when paired with other heroes it is arguably comparative to dynamic chess if not more complicated coupled with the iconic map as well as over a hundred items there is no possible hope of having a sense of deja vu in this game of course it entails an extremely steep learning curve but those who are willing to plough through the enourmous amounts of literature on the game and develop the necessary skills to make them competent will be greatly rewarded albeit at the cost of their social lives which has sadly happened to me of course there is no end to learning in dota it is said that only 50% of the time is spent in the game the rest is spent on reading up skills builds and other playstyles as well as watching videos of professionals duking it out with each other whether one derives enjoyment in self improvement through reading and watching is another matter on the other hand the infamous dota community is a force to be reckoned with as they are not so forgiving as communities of other games such as starcraft a piece of advice for newcomersdont let negative comments put you off the game everybody has to start somewhere

when i first tried to play dota 2  around the same time it came out  i made the mistake of jumping right on in thinking i knew exactly what i was doing obviously failing i gave up and left about tenminutes later and throughout the course of a few months i did this about fivetimes because i wanted to understand what the big deal was about it and why people found and still find this game so addictive up until recently i hated it with a passion  not only for being killed overandover  but also for the sheer complexity of it overall but now i know i wasnt taking the time to actually appreciate that complexity and realise that the learning curve was so full of depth that if you set your mind to it you can seriously enjoy it considering its all based around one map with the same gamemode every time its evident youd think itd get boring quickly  but youd be wrong even though this is the case theres so many different heroes with different abilities and different playstyles it just makes it more enticing its also extremely strategic and teammates count for everything which means youll be working together and maybe even making some more friends in conclusion this game is worth every hour youre willing to invest into it and if you enjoy learning teamwork and have an addictive personality like me then those hours are going to be endless

i remember the first time i played a moba back in starcraft playing aos which was later remade in warcraft aeon of strife aos thats how we came to know games of its like afterwards tides of blood popularized the custom map variant and the original dota and its ilk about 100 different or so versions of it spammed the custom map channels until all stars came in and swept the competitions now we see dota 2 here nearly a decade later and i have to say its even better than it was back then the balance now is impeccable not withstanding popular competitive picks the community is friendlier than lol or hons to say the least and although more complex than its competitors the game gives you everything from the start its a difficult game to be sure but as a rtsrpg hybrid it contains depths of strategy tactical complexity and splitsecond reflex gameplay that is sure to delight and impress any gamer dota 2 is a highly polished esport designed to draw in and awe is it perfect no is it good you bet for those of you who dont know what dota 2 is dota is a mobile online battle arena otherwise known as moba you control a singular hero and play in a team of five heroes whos task is to protect their ancient home base all while laying siege to the enemy ancient the team who destroys the opposing ancient wins the game in conclusion i highly recommend anyone to check this game out you wont be disappointed

recommended
dota has become one of the most popular games ever being one of the top 10 most played games on steam heres why the learning curve some might say this is the worst part of the game but almost no one can deny that its what gets you addicted and stuck in this world of heroes might and magic like any traditional moba each hero has its own distinctive role from support to carry and many other positions dota focuses mainly on building your character up in the beginning of a match and then through teamwork and strategy going head to head with the other team and pushing destroying the enemy teams towers creeps etc all the way to their ancient leading to its destruction and victory it might sound strange to someone who may be unfamiliar with moba style games but its an art and science within itself with millions of diehard fans constantly urging themselves to become better and more efficient with their playing styles with the inclusion of the 100 available characters there are at least five different ways to play each character meaning there is an insane amount of replayability already staked onto the stellar online multiplayer experience of both casual experienced and professional dota 2 players the games learning curve will take at least 40 hours of ingame time and potentially hours of research outside of the game youtube wikis etc which can seem like a major turn off for a game such as this however there is an offline practice mode available for new players to hone their skills and find out what characters they enjoy playing the most ive read the other reviews for dota 2 and found that many people are upset with russians and chinese going on us servers causing a language barrier and potentially losing games because of that i will admit this is a problem that will hopefully be fixed in the near future as it is rather problematic and detrimental to emerging victorious in a dota 2 match in conclusion dota 2 is a great game and has become one of my personal favourite games of all time the amazing diversity of every match the fantastic community and the overall amount of content being added every month is astonishing plus its a free to play not a pay to win its legitamately a f2p game what do you got to lose give dota 2 and try and find out what everyone is talking about you wont regret it

 disclaimer  this review is for the standard edition of batman arkham city as of 08082014 the review feature for said game has been disabled  this game is a bomb ive never been deeply into the batman franchise never read any comics back in the day when it was on tv batman  the animated series gained my attention and never lost it batmanarkham city is arguably the best longest and most refined entry in this current series of games it was thankfully developed by the rocksteady studio under the guidance of paul dini the main writer for the animated series that whole thing plays like a batman movie produced by christopher nolan talking about immersion you will think you are batman and that the events happening really occur to you as the witnessing player stunning graphics excellent sound design and a well rounded combat system give this game the edge it needs to turn you into a non lethal crime fighting combat machine comes with leaderboardschallenge maps and a multiplayer mode nothing short of a single player campaign 30 hours rich set up in an open air prison this game shows how deep the rabbit whole of human cruelty really goes this is lore wise easyly one of the best games ive ever played in my whole life and i hope rocksteady will soon deliver an arkham city 2 after the letdown that was arkham origins that what you get when you change a winning team eidos if you like super heros or punching based action games or just good movies in general pls do yourself a favour and buy this game itll be a sad story if you miss out on it

this is the best video game ive ever played hands down i have so much to say where do i start ok so dont be turned away by the huge learning curve when you start you will be terrible but thats ok and likely you may never be great but you will make amazing friends and have so much fun actually i wish i could go back to being a blissfully ignorant noob because learning heros abilities what certain items do lane compesitions ect i can go on forever about how much there is to learn even after 25k hours probably 15k  2k hours actually playing im still learning the game hits an odd paradox it can be the most satisfying and exciting game ive ever played but also the most enraging and frustrating its a ing emotional roller coaster sometimes there will be highs there will be lows from amazing comebacks to terrible throws great teamwork and brazilian  feeders ive even tried giving up after long agonizing losing streaks but nothing no other game can quite fill hole not playing this game for a few hours a day leaves its perfect for me i love being social competitive passionate and excited all maybe too much at times but thats just the kind of person i am some of my best friends ive made playing dota with and even though ive never meet most of them i love them all and noting can quite compare to queueing for a ranked captains mode game with a 5 stack valve is an amazing company and im glad they took the game and ran with it were constantly getting new seasonal events heros game modes and more cosmetic items i can throw my money at oh and one of the best parts all the heros are free and unlocked from the start no progression system where you can buy characters with in game currency or level up some  passives in a skill tree or something like a certain game you dont need to spend a dime but i strongly suggest you should considering your funding not only the people who make the game but the cosmetics are created by the community who they pay also all the items are tradeable ive spent countless hours browsing trading sites looking to swap my items that i got for free as random drops for my favorite heros new hat or whatever ive spent way too much time watching pro games as well which valve fully embraces they even host one of the biggest esport tournaments ever every year called the international i put a good bit of time into writing this review so thanks for reading it all if this even gets one person to give it a try then its not time wasted i hope you enjoy the game half as much as i do

if youre looking to play dota 2 chances are you already know something of the genra your stepping into you may have come from hon lol smite or other moba games the objective of dota 2 is to level up your hero gain gold xp and take down stuctures untill you can successfully kill the enemy anciant most mobas have this in common so what sets dota 2 apart from the rest simply put dota 2 is deeper in mechanics the skill cap is higher the esports matches are more dynamic and interesting and it has some berrier to entry if youre the type to pickup a new game and jump right in what really seperates dota 2 from others in the genre is the tone of each match you are punsihed for your mistakes but its your fault not the games rewarded for good play spells are much stronger earlier and roles for specific heros tend to be well establishedbut these roles can change as the meta game changes and new patches or heros emerge if you want to play dota 2 please play the tutorial offered and some bot matches practice different heros learn different roles and see what style of play best suits you also using the ingame guides get to know the heros in the learn tab as well as the items you can purchase videos can also be a godsend in learning the game as can playing with friends going into the actual mechanics of the game would make this review stretch way to long so its really up to you to find out youtube is a great place to find content to help you learn the ins and outs of each class character or mechanic if you are looking for a challanging and rewarding game dota 2 is definitely a great pick stick with it a bit learn the heros and have some fun with friends if you dont want a game that asks you to effort in to get something rewarding out then look elsewhere

i began playing dota 2 at a time when i thought moba games were the weakest of the game genres i always thought it was weird to play a game like this and whenever i saw gameplay videos of dota 2  i had no idea what the heck was going on it never occured to me though that this game would have baited me in for more hours of playtime when i first started dota there was some training missions i had to go through these explained the basics pretty well to me and eventually i thought i knew what i was doing also i also thought there wouldve been some sort of story mode due to the way the training was presented unfortunately there was none but i could see some potential for a storylike mode although during my first public matchup i did feel like quiting because i really did have no idea what i was doing and my teammates were complaining about how bad i was to the other team thats right the other teamour enemies then they all began calling me a noob the amount of insults i received were terrible but eventually i had a few other friends play the game along with me and thats when things began to change thats when dota 2 became something i actually loved to play because of friends and because my friends and i got better it came to a point when we started to insult the enemy team whenever we trashed them everytime we do that it would just end up with us having fun regardless of us winning or not thats what dota 2 is for me having a good time with friends and having fun i then tried lol and i came to the conclusion dota 2 > lol so since this game is free to play i highly recommend it its free so i say why not its best played with people you know after all it is a team based game there are more things to talk about in dota but if you want to know what they are play the game experience it

recommended
ah yes dota 2one of the best f2p games of the past several years i love this game to death as do a few of my friends but this ame isnt really suited for everyone so i thouht id use this space to point out some of the pros and cons that people should look for when checking out this game pros first off everything is free you dont need to pay to play a hero and cosmetic items are dropped periodically so you dont necessarily have to buy them yourself even if you do decide you want an item you can often get if for just a few cents on the steam market next up the hero diversity every hero feels fresh and unique despite the limited number of roles to play a support jakiro plays very differently from say a support shadow demon all of the carries supports initiators junglers nukers and gankers of the game have unique spells that allow you to simply switch heroes and feel like youre playing a completely different game now for the game itself dota 2 has a pretty decent variety of game modes and has special events from time to time as well diretide frostivus new bloom if you get bored of doing allpick games try out captains draft or the new random ability draft mode if you dont like playing against people there are also coop bot games of various difficulties and some of the harder bots are well actually a bit of a challenge cons this game is hard im not joking about that at all a lot of new players get discouraged because they come in expecting to be able to pick things up fairly quicklymost usually dont many of the games mechanics seem counterintuitive denying creepstowerslowhealth teammates and thus the learning curve is quite steep additionally a lot of new players fall into the trap of learning only one hero often pubstompers like rikki drow sniper and ursa and then have no idea what to do whe their favorite hero gets picked by someone else diversifydont just pick the same hero every game its ok to have a favorite to play but you need to be flexible to play this game now for the biggest issue in this game the community like every online game dota has its problems but people can just be jerks in this one one fineexample is the drow i played with recently she fed relentlessly standing under towers and never payed attention to pings or her minimap and then blamed us for dying constantly all she wanted to do was autoattack creeps ad hope to get a few lasthits in nevermind surviving long enough to spend the gold in this game very few people will admit their own mistakes it always has to be someone elses fault that you lost add to that the league players that you find every once in a while that only come on to shout obscenities into the mic while feeding im not saying all league players do this i enjoy both games from time to time and you have a recipe for very very frustrating games long story short great game thats hard to learn and hard to stick with unless you can deal with an  or two or four

the only arts worth actually playing in my opinion all the other ones around are made for people who cantdont want to learn how to play dota which usually means they end up with at least somewhat dumbed down mechanics not that this necessarily makes them bad games it just makes them a bit dull in my opinion this game will no doubt take a fair bit of time and reading to get into however it is possibly the most rewarding game ive ever played id say the time spent is well worth it because of the fairly large learning curve you cant judge dota by your first impression of it theres someone in particular im looking at here you know who you are solo queue is pretty bloody awful though unless you have a fetish for angry russians or something so id suggest never playing without at least one friend queuing with you my only other complaint about the game is that its ingame tutorial is quite frankly  while it does a good enough job covering basic mechanics that is also the only thing it covers and it will most likely teach you some bad habits along the way i recommend the guide at httpwwwpurgegamerscomwelcometodotayousuck  it covers practically everything you might want to know if you read through and remember the whole thing youre probably already better at dota than the average pubber but even reading less than half of the guide will give you enough knowledge to get you started as in not getting a kda of 0213 every game i definitely recommend this game to anyone with some leftover time on their hands and at least one friend who is a somewhat decent player one last thing to note games usually take about 45 minutes but its not uncommon to have games that last about an hour so make sure you have at least an hour before youll need to go do something when you start a match dont leave games unless it is absolutely 100% necessary it is a  thing to do and ruins the match for the 9 remaining people

wonderful game very entertaining and the atmosphere is a little more relaxed then the other popular mobas the beauty of this game is that it tends to emphasize individual initiative more than your ability to emulate the latest guides as cool as that is nothing really compares to the strong sense of nostalgia players of dota 1 will feel while playing since the game barrows as heavily from the original as is legally possible that said you absolutely have to play with at least two friends otherwise youre playing experience will go to hell very quickly 1  no regionalization of servers  ae theres going to be a lot of psychotic chittering mic spam and people who think they speak english are just going to shriek at you with preposterous accents unless reliving youre favorite moments of full metal jacket strikes you as being the epitome of strategic entertainment youll want to queue with some friends 2  self imposed dictators  ae everyone knows the self important team leader type some stranger you have never met seen or heard of who feels that its perfectly acceptable for him to tell you what skills youre going to pick during ability draft ext unless you enjoy angry nasally congested petty and vindictive mic spam youll want to grab some friends 3  steam is still technically pg7  ae only the characters in your games are allowed to curse stating to another player wow you sure suck at dota is a punishable offence this issue is compounded by the fact that the ban system is automated a player will automatically be banned based on the number of reports they accrue cross scaled by time they accrued them in fortunately i have managed to avoid any of the chat bans but some of my friends havent been so lucky consider the math one in four people on the internet may be defective four reports within a 2 hour period may get you banned you play three 40 minute games how is that going to shake out for you in the long run it may not happen to you and it hasnt happened to me but sooner or later you are going to get flagged and auto punished by the assbrains and this could compromise youre whole steam account you dont have to be a victim of an injustice to speak against it and i believe flatly that automated oversight is as dangerous as no oversight at all dangerous and foolish business so like i said bring at least two friends with you or prepare for a pretty hellacious experience otherwise its very fun

dota 2 is a british crime drama series produced by granada television for itv and created and principally written by jimmy mcgovern the series is centered on a criminal psychologist or cracker dr edward fitz fitzgerald played by robbie coltrane set in manchester it consists of three series which were originally aired from 1993 to 1995 a 100minute special set in hong kong followed in 1996 and another twohour story in 2006

i last reviewed this game over a year ago at the time i had played it for about a hundred hours in that review i spoke about its strategic depth adrenaline pumping action and emotional highs over a year later and ive played it for nearly 900 i was only scratching the surface dota is the thrill of scoring first blood in a bad matchup as well as despair of seeing the enemy spirit breaker gank yet another one of your teammates its flashy teamfights and precise positioning its chaotic 30minute slugfests and careful 70minute economic tugofwars its the uneasy suspense of snatching roshan right from under the enemy teams nose and its the mindnumbing frustration of having an enemy natures prophet knock yet another one of your towers down and get away clean it a hardfought victory snatched from the jaws of defeat and its watching your team get torn apart emotionally crumble and begin to blame each other dota is my favorite game of all time and i dont think ill ever experience anything like it ever again

as a drop while playing dota 2 because dota 2 is a freetoplay game players do not receive free cards like most other games instead a card drop becomes available for roughly every $9 usd spent on cosmetic items in the dota 2 store if you have card drops available they will appear automatically in your steam inventory as long as your dota 2 client is open cards drop approximately once every 1560 minutes from the steam community market by trading with another player from a booster pack booster packs are packets of several cards that drop randomly after you have forged one dota 2 badge booster packs can also be bought on the market booster packs drop more frequently for players with higher steam levels

here gentlemen the best moba around what to say about it hm well first of all theres absolutely no advantage for those who play the game longer other than experience why do people keep playing it well because its fun duh there is no rune system mastery skills talents or whatever you get from levels making the one who just started half an hour ago be on the same tier of the guy whos 1500 hours in which obviously wont get matched against each other because of the experience gap second everythings unlocked you dont have to grind or pay to play the heroes you want you want faceless void there you go lina sure why not visage yeah this is the part that gets to the new players as there is just so much in the game that god it just comes falling on top of your head and you easily get overwhelmed and third the cosmetics are avaliable for free considering youre lucky enough sure you can purchase them from the shop but you can also get them from drops after games might take a while but eventually youll get items these three things together make this games f2p model the best ever seen and will probably continue to be the best considering how freemium games are right now and last but not least the balance is flawless this is a topic where most people go but ursa is so op how is that balanced well son ursa may have his brute damage alright you touch him youre most likely dead but then again you must touch him to die and considering how slow he is thats pretty hard but he can get blink dagger and you can get ghost scepter which nullifies pretty much everything that he can do but thats in game strategy that newcomers usually dont know thats where the problem is dota is hard im not saying just your usual level of hard i mean hard you need to sink in 100 hours to start to get good at the game thats just crazy but somehow people love it dota different from other games such as those fps team deathmatches those capture the flags you can actually see the impact youre doing on the game youre not just killing people randomly youre contributing to your teams victory because with the kill also comes the tower and as you defend you know youre getting space and denying the enemy team control over your side as well as gold gold yes thats another cool point about dota after you play a match the hero you play the items you get the gold you painstakingly farmed are all gone gone you cant go back you cant enjoy that won match anymore where you will have to start over again with a new hero or the same one if you fancy him and talking about heroes there are a ton of them and thats the main point of the game youre almost guaranteed that you will never play with the same team line up versus each other and even if you do the match wont be the same it has nearly infinite replayability well folks and all that for the small price of one nothing now that you look at it it does seem like a great deal no and even if it isnt what do you have to lose dota get to it

recommended
lets play some dota so after participating in the open beta for 7 months and continuing to play the game until now there are endless reasons to keep coming back for more if you want an absolute black hole of a game and community that has persisted for over 10 years if you want to be frustrated and rewarded if you want to lose friends certainly this is not the kind of game that everyone should play but those who played the original dota or the original warcraft series will feel right at home here as a newcomer to the genre but a warcraft player from a young age its been nothing less than i would expect from the most popular wc3 mod of all time the steep learning curve has gotten better valve has taken many steps to ensure that new players will learn what they need to learn there are still so many little things and ways to respond to situations that dont come intuitively to people who are new but if you enjoy the mechanics and stick to the game eventually you will know what to do the game is very mechanically interesting although it takes some time to understand how it works whether you want to sit in fog and wait out the perfect 5 man ultimate farm until you are 6 slotted split push find pickoffs harass and deny there are so many unique ways to play the game different roles are so different and no two games are the same with that said the game generally stays the same an experienced player is an experienced player regardless of the balance changes valve and icefrogs team are constantly patching the game every year after ti they actually redesign the game in different ways it keeps things fresh and ensures that no hero is too strong for too long servers are not region locked so expect people who speak little or no english on both sides of the map unfortunately this happens more than youd think now this does create a language barrier in a game where communication is crucial but on the other hand it really doesnt matter too much unless the player is bad you will run into people who think they know exactly what they are doing but in reality they are playing at a much lower level than they can imagine you will start off as a decent person and you will keep your calm around bad teammates and in bad games but you will turn into the problem very shortly if you let yourself the problem with this game is if you want to mute someone you easily can but you never know if they are going to say something useful to be completely honest with the type of people you get in this game its usually worth having them muted regardless the hat system is better than lols rune system straight up to those who wish they could switch but feel they wont have anything to grind the gameplay itself is what you grind here if you wish to support the community and valve you can buy hats to make your heroes look cooler but beyond that theres nothing you can do or buy to change the game everyone has the same game one hero will always have the same stats and abilities as another player using the same hero the only thing that changes are cosmetics and as you can expect valve has an endless amount of them by now whether its the newest hero release and their beautiful arcana that you just have to have a fantastic announcer from a familiar game weather effects or the million different couriers that you can acquire when you spend your money on this games cosmetics it goes to the people who make the hats and valve gets a percentage thats it sometimes it will go towards a tournament prize pool or a player in closing play this game if you want a mix of warcraftdiablo that will test your sanity and willpower with high highs and low lows a skill ceiling that goes on forever and teammates that make you want to punch yourself in the face you will find yourself coming back for more every day if you have the time

recommended
if you want to hearsee in this case a review from someone whos played other mobas than dota 2 go elsewhere if not this is what i have to say about a game that ive sunk 600700 hours into until dota 2 i would have never considered myself truly addicted to a game although i wish i had spent those hundreds of hours doing something useful im going to explain why it was time well wasted first impressions the first thing that really struck me about dota is what many consider a negative thing its massive learning curve but as a person who appreciates a challenge i didnt find this to be such a major obstacle as many others havethe fact that this game is free totally makes up for it but if you appreciate games that hold your hand the whole way through this game probably isnt for you the shallow tutorial it does have explains the very basic mechanics of the game which is useful and all but this isnt a game thats easily explained the way to learn is really trial and error that why it really helps to have friends to play with you who firstly know what theyre doing and secondly have alot of patience this is a game of strategy diversity and tactics that will be far too complex to inherently know at the start its really really hard the community the community of dota is hands down the worst community ive ever had the displeasure of meeting ive played multiple mmos and other various multiplayer games but none of them came even closeexcept for cod except for cod as with any group of people there are also extremely nice and helpful people you can meet but thats heavily counterbalanced by sheer amount of trolls or whatever you want to call them the gameplay another point of contension about this game is its horrible match making system you wont notice it right away but as you increase in experience and skill you notice you are often grouped with people that either are completely new to the game or dont even speak your own language and in a game that relies heavily on teamwork and communication it becomes a very real disadvantage aside from that dota 2s gameplay is what makes the game what it is at first your head will spin with all the many many abilities that are constantly being thrown at you from the hundreds of characters that make up dota 2 but as you get more streetsmart and youve played most of the heroes youll find it easier and easier to be aware of your foes strengths and also use your enemies weaknesses to your advantage for the beginner the first thing you have to do as a complete greenhorn is to read this guide andor watch this video that are both very indepth guides to dota 2 i will link you to this at the bottom of my review after watchingreading the guide the links of which i have copied and oasted below i would strongly reccomend you first practice with bots a mode in which you are in a team with bots against bots dont dive in headfirst with your friends or with strangers as its really a drag to have someone constantly dying and feeding the enemy team gold and experience ultimately resulting in a loss and your friends coming up with excuses to leave your party once you have practiced i suggest you keep practicing for at least the first day you take the game up go ahead and play a coop bot game in this gamemode you will be grouped up with random strangers fighting against bots there are five difficulties the easiest of which is passive but personally i would suggest easy which is slightly harder than passive but a better way to learn in my opinion cons and pros pros 1 an amazing variety of heroes to choose from 2 the exhilaratingly palpable gameplay 3 the lore each hero has their own backstory which are all fantastic 4 the art style compared to other mobas that ive seen dota 2 has by far the best art style you can buy ingame item sets that change the aesthetic of your characters and many other accessories almost all of which are designed by artists and submitted to the dota 2 workshop 5 the multiplayer aspect this game is amazing to play with friends 6 this game is pefect for people who are looking for complexity and depth it has plenty of it 7 its an esport this game is surprisingly fun to watch and it happens to have a massive worldwide pro scene the dota 2 international is considered of of the largest gaming events ever with the price pool being racked up to 16 mil in total it should make for a very exciting event 8 its freeeeeeeeeeeeeee cons 1 the learning curve although i didnt have a problem with it is a major setback for most people 2 the matchmaking system a heavily flawed matchmaking system that often teams you up with people that dont speak your language andor are not at your skill level at all 3 the overpowered heroes although this becomes less of a problem as you get better at the game its a nightmare at the start of the game heroes such as viper sniper riki and many others wreak havoc among the noobs 4 the community the most vurile trolly community ever i hate this aspect of the game 5 its extremely addictive whether this counts as a pro or con is really up to you but i would say its more of a con in my opinion to recap dota 2 is not a casual game it takes time to learn and master every character in the game alot of time which is unattractive to alot of people because of the amount of depth dota 2 provides it takes a very long time recommended
is dota2 a fun game is usually the first question people ask about this game great games in recent times seem to often have set themselves apart from other games by being an experience game as an example proteus is 100% experience and very little game braid was great because it was an innovative platformer but some of the greatest lasting attraction i felt to the game was because of the endearing story and symbolism that was symbiotic to the music and art of the game dota 2 is not a game that tries to make it as easy as possible to experience the game and then be done with it unlike the set of games that have defined themselves a new genre in run of the mill first person shooters which make it as easy as possible for new players to complete sections of it and reach great heights in an attempt to lower the dominance new players have through tricks like fast healing killstreaks and fast respawns it doesnt fit with half life 2 like games in being a great singleplayer experience which you run through like a rollercoaster ride either each game starts out the same but can diverge in an incalculable number of ways due to the enormous number of variables innate in the vast number of heroes and builds dota 2 is a game a game with rules and learning and practising a game where you cant see the top of the skill ladder from the middle a game that is challenging and intriguing at every turn what is it that makes a game fun i dont think anyone knows the true formula but we know that fun activates the reward centres of the brain dota 2 will give you the rulebook and some practise scenarios but you cannot expect to have it play itself you must teach yourself the game and through your endeavours you will get noticeably better each time and you can and will feel proud of it dota 2 challenges both the intellect and the reflexes with battles between an enormous range of heroes each with interesting astoundingly well thought out and developed movesets and characters because of the sheer challenge and complexity of what dota 2 provides it is a very fulfilling game with much room for growth it is a game that will be enjoyable i expect for a very long time because of this dota 2 is not a game that is inherently fun in as much as you cant pick up a pack of cards for the first time and expect to play poker but we have touched only on the mechanics of the game dota 2 takes place on a very beautiful map complete with birds and squirrels fish and butterflies spiders and cobwebs day and night and forests and ravines in honesty all it would require for me to feel its atmosphere was perfectly polished would be weather effects it would be wonderful to see rain splashing in the river or even little streams the game has over 100 heroes each memorable with welldeveloped movesets storylines and copious amount of charactertocharacter dialogue which allow the games endearing heroes to cater to a huge variety of playstyles overall dota 2 is a game that is not made to take game of the year one year then fade into obscurity as people complete it its a game that sits in that category of games that you go to to have fun with some friends its a game that wants you to keep coming back to it and you know in years time you can still pick up the cards and have fun again if you want to pick up dota 2 which i should again emphasise requires some selfinvestment i suggest you ask a friend to introduce you oneonone to the games concepts with passive bots then practise with bots trying characters until you find one you like and are good at progressing to be able to beat the hard bots with little difficulty is very good preparation for multiplayer then all get on mic and play an online game youll win or at least have fun if you cooperate  zemnmez 2k13

this is a very competitive game with some incredibly complicated mechanics the graphics are nice everything runs well and ive rarely seen issues which are fixed on a regular basis what makes it entertaining to me is the combination of hundreds of available characters each with their own relatively unique skill set along with hundreds of items to be bought during the course of each match in a 5 man team there are endless combinations of roles which can make for a solid strategy there is a matchmaking system that does a fair job of creating balanced teams hopefully dear player after you have practiced playing with bots and know all of the heroes and an endless learning curve the only problem i have with the game is how much abuse is prevalent in the community new players are able to join matches before they have the experience to make reliable teammates and rather than give them advice or instruction many would simply vote to kick a player from the team and 4v5 is hardly ever winnable i wish there were more people able to demand some respect and cooperation that i had more reports for those who use the word noob regularly and then claim the game is over before it began because of anything else if you like competition teamwork hilarious math reflexes and leadership then this is one of the best games youll find but it will be frustrating at times

you wont like dota2 you may be one of the millions of people that think you like it already playing it and making it the single most popular game on steam by a ridiculous margin but thats only because you dont understand it dota2 is pure abstraction complexity for the sake of complexity and rule sets within rule sets that are broken at random this game is so far removed from the theme of heroes with swords and spells clashing in combat that you might as well be playing a game of chinese whispers in a mental institution for the mathematically insane many of the subsystems only function the way they do now because of the limitations of the warcraft 3 engine while many others have been quietly modified for this sequel this game is a triumph of accidental design that rewards memorization social adroitness deductive reasoning and the ability to predict what other humans will do in a complex system that they do not understand ask yourself why you play games at all compare the aforementioned truths attributed to this game to your definition of fun you see ive just saved you a lot of time this game wasnt made for you it was made for me

this is my review for one of my favorite games dota 2 dota 2 is much like league of legends in the sense that it is a moba game and the best moba out there i have tried other mobas like lol and infinite crisis yet dota 2 seems to prove its the best of them all with over 100 heros dota 2 is very diverse from other games where each hero has a great skill set and personality each hero serves a role ingame and items are bought to your choosing or what best fits the hero but the game is very balanced because each skill and items can be countered by another skill or items this makes each and every game unique and very stratigic based after over 500 hours ingame i have come to love this game you couldnt ask more from a free game and it is very fun although it is free the game does have a store where you can purchase items that change the appearance of your hero or hud to having the ingame voice somebody else to making your own workshop content that could be put into game training for the game at first is very difficult and alot to take in at first but if you are persistant and play against bots to practice and better your skills dota 2 becomes one of the best games out there although the game is hard to understand at the start and the community is harsh on noobs with time this game is one of the best free games out there and i highly recommend it

this is a very competitive game with some incredibly complicated mechanics the graphics are nice everything runs well and ive rarely seen issues which are fixed on a regular basis what makes it entertaining to me is the combination of hundreds of available characters each with their own relatively unique skill set along with hundreds of items to be bought during the course of each match in a 5 man team there are endless combinations of roles which can make for a solid strategy there is a matchmaking system that does a fair job of creating balanced teams hopefully dear player after you have practiced playing with bots and know all of the heroes and an endless learning curve the only problem i have with the game is how much abuse is prevalent in the community new players are able to join matches before they have the experience to make reliable teammates and rather than give them advice or instruction many would simply vote to kick a player from the team and 4v5 is hardly ever winnable i wish there were more people able to demand some respect and cooperation that i had more reports for those who use the word noob regularly and then claim the game is over before it began because of anything else if you like competition teamwork hilarious math reflexes and leadership then this is one of the best games youll find but it will be frustrating at times

dota 2 is quite similar to the famous league of legends but has also some minor and major differences in the following two sections ill discuss in short the positive and negative sides of this game even though there is more text i think in the negative section i still think that this game is great and fun to play positive  the earned xp doesnt alter the gameplay but only unlocks specific modes and items  you dont have to buy heroes like in league of legends the only thing that stops you from picking a specific hero is the game mode you are playing  the game is indeed a superb model for freetoplay  the stuff you buy or dont buy dont stop you from enjoying it completely it also does not give any perks that can ruin the overall impression of the game  like all sourceengine games dota 2 can run smoothly even on a trashy pc configuration i have two computers  a notebook that is approx 2 years old and a workstation from the 2007 the gpu is meant for cad and is not good for gaming on both with the right configuration machines dota 2 runs great if you have a 56 years old and more pc you might still be able to enjoy the game since im more of a its all good when the gameplay is great guy eyecandy visuals are not important for me lowering this and that setting is not the worst that can happen make sure however that it runs smoothly since this might ruin not only your enjoyment of the game but also of those who play with you  community  profanity is not uncommon but compared to the one behind league of legends the dota2community is more mature since its still young this might change in time lets hope not  ranked mode unlocks after the player has reached a certain number of games  even though the player might have 100 losses out of 100 games i can hardly imagine someone with such a groundbreaking record it is still a pleasant thing to know that once you start playing ranked most of the players will actually have some experience with the game  ability to train against ai andor with a coach  to ensure that the players are given the opportunity to learn if they want to valve gives us all the chance to test new heroes and strategies against ai andor with a coach another player that wants to help you learn the game  many game modes  there is a decent number of game modes that you can enjoy all of them have their strengths and weaknesses but still quite enjoyable to play  mute option is a blessing  the above mentioned maturity of the dota 2 community has its exceptions of course you might end up with a crazy person who screamsinsults or just belches on hisher microphone distracting you lucky enough for all of us who actually use the voice chat for its intended purposes there is a mute button next to each player in the list of players menu negative  reporting system is not mature enough im saying this as someone with over 100 games behind his back and not a single ban or put on the low priority queue some people simply abuse it just because they cannot deal with some personal issues or whatever and decide that whoever is not following their lead should be reported in a worst case scenario a great deal of the game goes by while threats for reporting someone are made instead of simply enjoying it the given options to report a player are also quite limited for example there is no way to report a player who is idle doesnt do anything at all he is not feeding he is not abusing his abilities and is not feeding since his hero is just camping at the base what do you do in such situations the verbal abuse over voice chat is also not possible to report as far as i know  frequent updates  of which i get sometimes 34 per day which of course leads to the prompt your client is out of date way too often after an update it is not uncommon that the game simply crashes silently im playing on linux so i cant say anything about the windows client of the game  lots of bugs  mentioning linux reminded me of the couple of bugs that seem to reappear from time to time such as the weird key binding menu bug where the player is unable to assign a specific key comination in most cases connected with the chatall command which hasnt been working on my client since day one one other bug that has still not been fixed is the famous invulerable dc disconnected player the player abandons the game and is replaced by a bot who might turn invinsible this leads to some weird situations where players in the game are killed by this bug the usual solution in this case is to push on those lanes where the invinsible bot is not present as fast as possible the bot is not shot at by your own creeps and towers so it just goes along a lane and kills everything on its path i even experienced a situation where such bug appeared on both teams  abandoning the game  im totally for punishing people who just dc and dont come back abandoning intentionally their teammates but its really unfair if you get points in this overall bad statistic for games that crashed sometimes the client crashes and again and again so the time you are given to come back to the game might not be enough sometimes the connection might be so bad that the amount of lag might turn you into an unintentional feeder  stay in the game and feed or leave it i have a decent internet connection but sometimes the problem might come from the servers that valve places at your dispossal i have experienced some games that are sluggish and not just for me but for all other players what to do in such situations when things dont improve i have 2 abandons because of the reasons ive mentioned above  ai  if you play solo against bots that you must do at least at the beginning during training you will find out that maybe in 99% of all games the bots on your team act dumber to say the least comapred to those on the opponents team they not only feed way too much but they also have some basic issues like a decent path finding ive seen plenty of bots getting stuck somewhere and it takes quite a while for them to realize that they cant go in that specific direction since ive mentioned feeding i care to note also that the bots that replace dcs can be a major pain for your team especially if the players that were playing those heroes were high level the ai of the bots in multi is pathetic and they respawn go straight forward to a specific lane even though there is a certain chance of death ahead and get killed giving xp to the opposite team this routine repeats over and over again  matching  the nonranked game mode has a really weird matching system if you are level x in a game you might get players with level x10 x20 etc needless to say it is great to have someone more experienced than you to teach you but i believe thats what the coaching is for the first time i realized this weird matching system was more or less at the beginning of the game when i was level 4 and actually played with someone on my team with level 21  ability draft game mode  i give a special attention to this mode because there is something that reallly bothers me namely the absence of heroinformation on the board where you select your abilities if you havent played all the heroes when this mode gets unlocked you might end up getting a bad surprise not knowing basic things about your hero such as is it melee or ranged is it a carry or a nuker etc the meleeranged is actually not given anywhere in any of the modes at least i havent seen a hint about it but at least in other modes you are given the chance to chat to the other players you are going to play with and ask them those things in ability draft you can only use voice chat to ask questions which might not be an option if other players dont speak your language andor youthey dont have or dont want to use a microphone

recommended
a worthy sequel dota 2 have been developed for the past 2 years since its closed beta on 2011 where invites are poured out to players on steam i may not be of those lucky few that have gotten the invite but nevertheless after i experienced in from a friends account i must say valve has successfully elevated the progenitor of the moba genre to the next level with improvements that can only be possible with more advanced game engines i myself has been a dota player in the past and seeing the sequel made but still having its core game play maintained brings a warm joy to my heart since the core mechanics of dota like denying creep stacking or even juking has been successfully brought back to this game dota 2 still manages to bring the competitive atmosphere into players both new or veterans alike since the core mechanics are not changed and then i would like to mention the huge improvement the game has bought is the shop system in game where we can just click on an item if we have the enough amount of money since its pretty tad confusing if you are new to dota 2 and you dont know what are the item builds for each particular hero since dota 2 can be really challenging by mastering different item builds for different situations or the hero mechanics itself a long and tedious journey awaits you but once you have mastered the mechanics then your satisfaction will be very high another major improvement is the tutorial system that valve has implemented such as introducing close combat with dragon knight and long range combat with sniper and also laning tutorials which can help new players to overcome their fear in laning against enemy heroes probably the newest addition is the last hit training which shows players how to last hit a creep to gain more gold and experience this is useful for new comers and veterans alike to hone their skills the steam workshop system also works very well with the game where players can contribute their unique items made for heroes in gamethese items can also be implemented in game through the communitys help by up voting the particular item which is also a fair way for players to get their favorite cosmetic items from the workshop to be implemented in game me myself kept regularly browsing the workshop to see the ideas of the players around the world and its amazing on how you can see a lot of fresh content from players around the world however the community of dota 2 maybe very harsh on new players since i have seen players that tends to be harsh to newcomers since they havent mastered the core mechanics and flame them regularly but dont take it to heart since there are also some good left in this community you will come across gamers with patience and are willing to teach you to get better and even enemies that can cheer you up and joke around with you even though they are losing or winning the game overall i give the game a 910 for its reinvention of the titular dota title and with new improvements such as customization options while still retaining the core mechanics makes this gamea worthy sequel

dota has become one of the most popular games ever being one of the top 10 most played games on steam heres why the learning curve some might say this is the worst part of the game but almost no one can deny that its what gets you addicted and stuck in this world of heroes might and magic like any traditional moba each hero has its own distinctive role from support to carry and many other positions dota focuses mainly on building your character up in the beginning of a match and then through teamwork and strategy going head to head with the other team and pushing destroying the enemy teams towers creeps etc all the way to their ancient leading to its destruction and victory it might sound strange to someone who may be unfamiliar with moba style games but its an art and science within itself with millions of diehard fans constantly urging themselves to become better and more efficient with their playing styles with the inclusion of the 100 available characters there are at least five different ways to play each character meaning there is an insane amount of replayability already staked onto the stellar online multiplayer experience of both casual experienced and professional dota 2 players the games learning curve will take at least 40 hours of ingame time and potentially hours of research outside of the game youtube wikis etc which can seem like a major turn off for a game such as this however there is an offline practice mode available for new players to hone their skills and find out what characters they enjoy playing the most ive read the other reviews for dota 2 and found that many people are upset with russians and chinese going on us servers causing a language barrier and potentially losing games because of that i will admit this is a problem that will hopefully be fixed in the near future as it is rather problematic and detrimental to emerging victorious in a dota 2 match in conclusion dota 2 is a great game and has become one of my personal favourite games of all time the amazing diversity of every match the fantastic community and the overall amount of content being added every month is astonishing plus its a free to play not a pay to win its legitamately a f2p game what do you got to lose give dota 2 and try and find out what everyone is talking about you wont regret it

dota 2 promises to take the unique blend of online rts and rpg action that has made dota popular with tens of millions of gamers and expand upon it in every way this is a competitive moba game of action and strategy played both professionally and casually by millions of passionate fans worldwide players pick from a pool of over a hundred heroes forming two teams of five characters radiant heroes then battle their dire counterparts to control a fantasy landscape waging campaigns of cunning stealth and outright warfare put a few hundred hours into a game and youll normally have its mechanics down pat you may not be the greatest player ever but you can usually expect to be at least competent and able to make a valuable contribution to your teams efforts sure some teenager all hopped up on mountain dew and pubertal rage is still going to have faster reactions than you but youll get by until you pick up dota 2 in dota 2 you can play for a hundred hours and still be the most useless n00b to ever play the game a let down to your team an embarrassment to friends and family its a brutal game but if you get into itand not everyone willit can make a fullon heroin addiction look like nothing more severe than a mild hankering

recommended
dota2 is the highly successful sequel to the warcraft 3 custom map defense of the ancients the original dota was the parent of the moba genre that we enjoy today and dota2 has done an amazing job carrying on the legacy if you were a fan of the original or enjoy the current moba games on the market such as league of legends heroes of newerth or smite  give dota2 a chance there are literally dozens of heroes to choose from with multiple item builds for each hero this can make the learning curve a little steep but there is a decent tutorial system in place for helping new players learn there is also an improved bot mode now where you can practice against ai and hone your skills until you feel comfortable playing with other players ranked play adds a more competitive arena for players looking to improve and advance and there is now a solo mid 1v1 mode to practice laning if you so choose dota2 is an ever evolving game and growing into a prominent esports arena it isnt for everyone and players that get frustrated easily might want to avoid it the community can be a bit hostile towards newer players but with some patience you can find great players and make friends that will help you through the process

this is one the best games you could ever come across but everything has its pros and cons ill write its here gameplay  it is a typical moba genre game you select a hero from 112 heroes each hero has unique abilites which cost mana to cast that are used to assist the hero along with its physical attacks which deal variable damage to kill the enemy heroes a typical dota 2 game is about 30  50 minutes you kill uncontrolled units called creeps in the starting phase of the game to gain gold and xp and later fight the enemy heroes along with your team to destroy their base and their ancient pros   helps improve  strategical thinking  teamwork  quick decision making  reflexes  observation power  ability to predict  fun to play  relaxing  antiboredom  keeps you away from porn because its so addictive cons   time wastage  affects eyesight  affects vertebral column  very addictive  bad grades  inability to concentrate  makes you racist  makes you antisocial  makes you violent  makes you aggresive  makes you frustrated too often  makes you abusive  makes you cold hearted  affects relationships  many more should you play  whether you should play or not depends on what you want if youre looking for a good strategical game involving teamwork and quick reflexes and decision making this is what youre looking for however if youre looking for a casual game just to kill some time and youre pretty busy through the rest of the day or if youre a student this game is just not for you however id recommended that keeping in view the risks of this game that ive mentioned in the cons you should if you can afford the risks give this game a try atleast note  most of the cons only appear once you play it online since theres close to no cons in the game itself besides being addictive and the other physical effects of excessive computer use the main reason for the cons is the extremely toxic community everyone rages everyone flames everyone abuses everyone blames here welcome to dota
