recommended
dota 2 has its origins in early warcraft custom games the style popularized by euldota1 later was handed off to guinsoodota1 20euls scepter of divinity was needed to make guinsoos scythe of vyse in earlier versions which was then taken into its final chapter by icefrogdota allstarsguinsoo started allstars originally but the bulk of the allstars era was under icefrog dota 1 was by far the best game ever made in my opinion due to the tight knit cult community the constant state of balance and updatesometimes 34 times daily if something was wrong they would fix it right away not funded so no money grab aspect just all was focused on a quality game with quality people playing having the forum voting system actually gave the players and community a chance to decide together how the game would evolve dota 2 since being taken over by valve has done a nice job to keep some of the great gameplay aspects that being said the invite only phase was the closest you would get to that dota 1 experience the community has been flooded with the free to play craze giving them a market to exploit this has caused the content the gameplay and the general enjoyment to be watered down from its vastly superior original it has a chance to be fixed the servers need to be improved and keep people that speak the same language and a similar skill level matched up it currently is a mess and you almost have to get lucky to have an enjoyable game i still give it a yes for the chills i get when i hear the lina announcer say hawt stuff and raaaampage also the nostalgia feels of the good days when games were developed to be art and quality and complete without the thought of how to make money

here which will give u more experience from the match but this only increases your cosmetic items loot also forgot to mention that every item from the shop can be looted via match rewards second of if youre a gamer you would probably have heard of the term moba which stands for multiplayer online battle arena and one of the games leading the way in that genre is dota since thats where it basically all began dota 2 is a direct sequel to the original bringing us updated graphics and easier controls making the already difficult game a bit more accessible to newer people for the genre this game is very much like a sport in which it requires lots of strategies and teamcoordination in order to win however much like a sport it requires time and patience to hone your skills in order to be good at it so if youre willing to put the effort into it dota 2 can be an extremely enjoyable and satisfying experience for you just be wary that there are a considerable number of players in the community who can be considered toxic and can be very unfriendly if you can somehow try to avoid them as much as possible eg only playing with friends you know youre going to have a blast with this game good luck and have fun

dota 2 is a very extensive and deep game but this depth and complexity in my opinion means a great ceiling of fun i really enjoy this game you can play as an oblivious person with your oblivious friends and derp around the game and have lots of fun trying to bash each others heads in while trying to break that coveted ancient but be warned if you enjoy this game you might want to try playing online playing online is a different experience entirely team work becomes so much much oh ever so much much so muchly much much more crucial than before drsuess reference xd if you are still playing with your group of friends though at this point that should help a lot but like many people myself included you will be in games where you are alone amongst 4 strangers all of whom have their own agenda seemingly it is not always like this you will try your best to help your team win but it will inevitably end in a couple of your teammates being headstrong idiots who fed the other team let the other team kill them to many times then the fed team is big bad and bulky then you lose there are games where you and your team will work together and you will destroy that will not always be the case so enjoy it when it happens and get over it when it doesnt if you plan on being great at this game be prepared to spend hours researching what the items do all of the recipes heroes skills especially ultimates and watch games of people who are good i reccomend purge hes on youtube if all this seems overwhelming its because this game can be crazy overwhelming however it has potential to be crazy fun the bottom line is what you put into this game is what you will get out of it at the time of this review i have 270 hours ingame and i still feel relatively noobish i have been having fun this whole time however so if you dont feel like putting away crazy amounts of time into a game then i suggest you get 19 friends who also dont know how dota works to get this game and just play private games together and have a blast because it is quite a lot of fun a little about me i played dota 1 the warcraft iii mod as a latecomer with 1 other friend game after game and we derped plenty but through those games i learned about the stats and recipes of about 90% of the items in the game giving me a pretty sizable advantage i could have made this review about ten times longer but then it would have been a guide it already kind of is 1010 by the way this game is great

recommended
it all started as a map for warcraft 3 today it is the best of its kind around not too surprising to be honest valve games are usually astonishing dota 2 is no exception it is a complete work of art in many ways graphics this game has a slight cartoonish feel to it with fitting colors and lovely particle effects it is not too demanding but at the same time not that easy to run an average computer should be able to handle it the skill effects for dota 2 are incredible well made and satisfying while not crossing the border of being disorienting sound incredible soundtrack with many fitting masterpieces for different situations and places skill sounds have a great oomph to them and are very well made overall what i absolutely love about dota 2 when it comes to sound would be the voices hero voices this game has the greatest voice acting i have ever seen in my life not only limited to video games the lines are incredible well thought of the so called responses in the game of dota 2 are full of different expressions they are the main thing that is funny about this game gameplay dota 2 takes alot of skill almost too much dont jump into public games if you just started even if you played the original or other arts games practice all heroes learn their skills and their playstyles if you dont know if your enemy can jump right in your face or summon a black hole right in the middle of your team you will not be performing very well controls in dota 2 are not as hard as the gameplay itself the generic skill buttons are q w e and r d and f are also used for heroes who use more than 4 skills no worries veterans you can use the legacy hotkeys in dota 2 when it comes to the actual gameplay dota 2 is more of a strategy game than some sort of action game much like the typical rts game you need to plan out your game and change up your plans according to the match you are playing one really important thing about dota 2 would be teamwork without teamwork you cannot do anything past your first few matches this game is built on working as a team and is best played as a 5man team items dota 2 like tf2 has items these items are purely cosmetic and have absolutely no gameplay advantages that come with them dota 2 is a competitive game and if you put a pro player with 6000 hours into dota 2 with someone who never played dota 2 before against eachother the only thing to matter is skill and teamwork there are absolutely no perks or runes as you have in league of legends not even miniscule bonuses everyone is equal the items in this game are made by the community you can make your own items and if they make it into the game you will actually earn money from this game dota 2 items can be sold and bought from the steam marketplace if a set is 13 dollars on the dota 2 store you can buy it for 2 dollars on the marketplace other the hud and main menu for this game are very well made while the hud is rather big it is actually pretty small compared to the amount of information it holds the main menu is well made and easy to navigate at most cases the matchmaking system for this game is not too bad but is rather lacking you will experience alot of difficulties caused by foreign players as you will not be able to communicate with them it is best to get used to being matched with russians when you are playing on us east servers with the english language setting dota 2 has a report system as well as a commend system the report system is rather flawed as people can easily banned for things they didnt do but still the amount of times this happens is rather low punishments for getting reported would be low priority which i will explain later and a communication ban which disables a bunch of your communication features and limits some low priority makes you get matched slower and disabled earing battle points  exp for your profile  and items during gameplay final dota 2 is a valve masterpiece can be played for years to come once you get past the learning curve

recommended
dota 2 or defense of the ancients 2 is a great free to play game keeping real to the original mod of warcraft 3 many people dont know the origins but this title began as a gamemod for warcraft 3 it was so intuitive and successful that it spawned an entire multiplayer online battle arena or moba genre basically it is a game created maintained funded promoted and played solely by gamers to know that this formula has lead it into a limelight of success is a warm feeling to anyone involved the support this game has received has been phenomenal though the concept is fairly simple dota 2 is a professional game experience much like a game of baseball or football the stage is set in an online computer regulated fantasy battlefield arena which makes the action more interesting and the gameplay more fair players join together in groups of five to take on opponents casually with public matchmaking or by forming professional competitive teams each player picks from a rooster of 100 heroes each with unique abilities and statistics players then battle on a field of war where the two npc armies release waves of troops to engage each other this is where the game refines itself though the stage does not change each battle is unique and requires great concentration and mastery to defeat your enemy to become successful does require a certain level of prowess so it is recommended new players begin by trying out a couple hundred public matchmaking games you might think im joking but that is just the start of the journey as you become more successful your rankings will increase making you more attractive for recruiters unless you already have a team formed and have had previous competitive experience you might not be immediately ready for high level gameplay do not be discouraged however the game is great about teaming you up with players of your own skill level because the game is team based by nature it is natural to meet new friends online to play with it is important to be courteous and not overly rude because your reputation spreads if you are friendly and assist your teammates they may grant you after battle accolades or want to become your friend if you are rude and flaming your teammates will work against you or sometimes quit altogether in your early stages it is important to be open and respectful if youre not sure what to do dont be afraid to ask the game features an awesome built in microphone system so if you own the hardware talking to your opponents is as easy as a click as you complete more battles you earn more rewards experience accolades and friends rewards include special items and equipment for your heroes special effects and modifications to the user interface and stage design custom load screens custom courier graphics custom animations and plenty of exclusives which can be bought and sold on the steam market probably the only downfall here is the high intensity and length these games operate on it is not unusual for a good game to take hours to complete sometimes it can be really heart pounding when you have a close game and both teams are equally matched the minions flood the screen and team battles clash on eventually leading a single team to victory though the game lacks a lot of what a traditional game is expected to have it is still a full experience dota 2 has come a long way and its ambition as a flagship for competitive gamers is something to respect its an awesome experience to be part of having the full support of steam and by having content designed by the player base we see a role for anyone who is not successful with the sometimes overly competitive aspect much of the reason the original defense of the ancients was successful was because the community had such a large input into the designs of the game often the developers recruited within the games player base or other well known modders to help design their masterpiece todays dota 2 sees even larger support having systems in place to collect almost all 3d model submissions when new heroes are designed players are both testers and developers of expansion content this experience makes you feel in touch with the game ultimately however this game is for the players battles are tough and the more experienced you become the more difficult opponents you will become matched with there comes a point where being matched against a fully microphoned team is going to become common because i have played this game for so long and know a lot about it i am not immediately put off by this however be warned prolonged exposure to dota 2 is definitely not a casual experience though i always recommend one conduct themselves in the best manor for an optimum experience you will encounter those who do not agree with these principles dota 2 has become a source of income for some so it is important to those individuals to never lose if you dont really care if you win or lose and are just looking for a quick way to pass the time this game can provide you and a group of friend tons of fun if you are looking to follow the road of success prepare for a difficult journey i definitely recommend dota 2 for all gamers that would call themselves competitive it is simple sleek and sexy highly appealing and easy to pick up best of all free and highly compatible and supported link directly up to your steam account and find out which of your friends play already you might be surprised spending money in this game almost always results in only ascetic changes this game is definitely not a pay to win game in fact one might even generate your own steam dollars by selling the items won from this game download it today

very rude and racist towards anyone who even looked at me then i quit because reasons then my life started improving i lost most of the weight i gained i was dating i got a nice job and i excelled in all my university classes then dota2 came out i was given a beta key and it sat in my steam inventory for many months taunting me its red glow symbolizing some deepseated temptation that made me think of nefarious djinns of stories long forgotten so inviting and so beautiful but i knew its secrets and i knew what those secrets did to me but sadly even the strongest and tallest mountain will eventually fall and crumble to the gentle peppering of rain after the fivehundreth im lying it was like 3 probs demand that i start playing my willpower gave in and fell into the blackness once again i could feel some etheral blackness grasp its fingers around my stillrecovering mind as the game finished installed and i pressed that play now button i realized that i just jumped off the bridge that i was so very carefully constructing ever since quitting the first dota everything came rushing back to me one game became ten and ten games became onethousand my girlfriend when i began again has saw when i looked at dota 2 on steam for the first time i saw an complicated version of classic hero brawler so i said no screw this ill go play a game that makes sense so i started playing league of legends or lol which lasted me about 3 months until i came to a realization that lol was simply dull it did not make me think and the people they just made the game horrible and enjoyable sure their was the few great games that truly said this is true teamwork but overall i every time i played a new game i would sigh then choose one of the 3 overly expensive heros i had purchased then stared at the unimpressive dull graphics and then got yelled at my team mate for stealing his creep last hit so then after staring at the dota 2 page on steam for a few minutes and watching a few video guides on how to survive as a noob in dota 2 finally i pressed download and slowly but surely it downloaded and after have a friend beat the tutorial for me i played my first bot match after four minutes i quit because it simply just made no sense i didnt comeback to dota until a friend invited me to play dota and i warned him to be careful because i would probably just feed the other team but he urged me on and forced me to play a bot game he explained the basics and while me and him coordinated the first blood play i realized the greatness in this game it was having great friends that you can rely on to pop a healing salve on you right before you did and they save your life or when you and your friend find someone jungling in your jungle so you and him just destroy him with mass damage and you both start laughing but in dota 2 another great aspect about it is that you must think you have to react predict hope about what may happen to you i feel i have just gotten started with this game and i already play over 125 hours overall dota 2 has some great features that make it step out from some hero brawler likes dota 2 has some great teamwork when you talk it is a great mind game that helps you with strategy that makes you think can be a easy win for you if you just use simple teamwork has great graphics compared to most mobas dislikes intense learning curve you can be matched up with a horrible team that just trolls you overall score 879

all my university classes then dota2 came out i was given a beta key and it sat in my steam inventory for many months taunting me its red glow symbolizing some deepseated temptation that made me think of nefarious djinns of stories long forgotten so inviting and so beautiful but i knew its secrets and i knew what those secrets did to me but sadly even the strongest and tallest mountain will eventually fall and crumble to the gentle peppering of rain after the fivehundreth im lying it was like 3 probs demand that i start playing my willpower gave in and fell into the blackness once again i could feel some etheral blackness grasp its fingers around my stillrecovering mind as the game finished installed and i pressed that play now button i realized that i just jumped off the bridge that i was so very carefully constructing ever since quitting the first dota everything came rushing back to me one game became ten and ten games became onethousand my girlfriend when i began again has left me already and i feel nothing but pity for her because she only wants me to leave the one i trulty love im gaining weight again but whatever i dont even care  i remember liek when my friend was like wanna come party after exams and i was like no  that lol i have an ih to do i skipped some exams tho cuz i didnt rly have much time to study cuz ti3 was hapepning and i wanted to watch enough games so i wuldnt be mad that i msised it but i had to quit cuz im failing university and its gettin 2 expensive 2 live in campus otherwise 1010 good game i have 700 hours logged into dota2 and im still casual as

i thought i enjoyed this game i played public pickups for quite a bit having never played a moba before i spent a lot of time reading up and watching videos before even playing so that i knew some basic terminology and callouts and general strategy for two characters that i could get started with based on my pub experience i would have said i felt like an average player after a few dozen hours nothing special but enjoying myself and seeing that i could grow over time unfortunately experiences with other players generally sucked almost never got a full game going people always dropped out within the first few minutes nobody ever communicated because despite being on amer server more than half of the players tend to be russian brazilian etc im sure it wasnt enjoyable for them to be grouped with people that they couldnt communicate with either the one real positive aspect i felt was that i didnt experience much of the absolute hate and bile that mobas and dota are known for and that i was warned about before trying to play that was when i was playing in pubs then i was invited into a group to play i guess everyone i played with was much more experienced than me because the game was nothing like i had experienced in pubs i made them aware that i had no clue what i was doing and was completely new to the whole genre having a little experience and done some readingvideo watching i started the match off with high hopes by the end of the match i had experienced a bunch of yelling and angry correction by teammates most frustratingly i found myself being chastised by teammates for not doing one thing  and then when i did as instructed being chastised again for doing that  i dont mind being corrected im open to guidance and learning how to play    but this experience was so frustrating i learned nothing as a result of being told to do one thing and then chastised for it when doing it instead of something else not to mention people being audibly frustrated by my not being aware of complex combinations between characters and equipment and strategy something i dont see how i could be expected to know so early in my experience as a result that was the only grouped game i ever played the only higher ranking nonpub game i ever played it was also the last game of dota period that i played i logged off and after a few days i uninstalled the game i have not been back in almost two years i should clarify that im not easily dissuaded for games and i dont have a problem with abrasive communities racist hateful etc is a different thing  but i can handle fair criticism and enjoy trash talking this was just more than i could take especially combined with the incredible learning curve that ramped way up between pub seeming to be worthless to play as everyone told me you dont learn anything in a pub and actual games way more advanced almost immediately and difficult to be of value in as a newbie anyway i envy those people who have made it over that curve and somehow reached a point where theyre a successful knowledgeable experienced player who can hold their own in serious competition and dont constantly feel like the heel dragging everyone down that everyone wants to disconnect i just somehow couldnt get there as a result i ultimately despise this game but cant help but recommend that someone give it a try there are very few flaws that seem to be inherent to the game itself and the complexity and variety truly offers endless play

if youre a gamer you would probably have heard of the term moba which stands for multiplayer online battle arena and one of the games leading the way in that genre is dota since thats where it basically all began dota 2 is a direct sequel to the original bringing us updated graphics and easier controls making the already difficult game a bit more accessible to newer people for the genre this game is very much like a sport in which it requires lots of strategies and teamcoordination in order to win however much like a sport it requires time and patience to hone your skills in order to be good at it so if youre willing to put the effort into it dota 2 can be an extremely enjoyable and satisfying experience for you just be wary that there are a considerable number of players in the community who can be considered toxic and can be very unfriendly if you can somehow try to avoid them as much as possible eg only playing with friends you know youre going to have a blast with this game good luck and have fun

when i first played the game i was confused and didnt understand the strategy behind mobas frustrated i quit the game for a year but i came back to try again i learned from my mistakes and took in some advice along with watching a few videos on the basics of the game once i had a grasp of it and knew what i was doing i began to enjoy the game much much more the game has great lore simple controls and an easytouse shop this game is also truly f2p yes you can buy items from the market that use actual realworld money but these items are purely cosmetic and do not give you an advantage whatsoever most of these cosmetic items can be earned by simply playing the game which in my opinion makes it truly f2p this game also has excellent steam integration with free guides to help you learn the game in short this is a fantastic game that i intend to spend many more hours playing i fully recommend this title to gamers of all skill levels

most people on steam have probably heard the name of this game countless times now so let me give you a short and simple review on it get it now that thats out of the way try and use the tips i am about to give you so you can get he best possible experience that this game has to offer dota 2 has a steep learning curve meaning you cant just jump in there and expect to know what you are doing when you first launch the game as of recently you are taught how to play through the tutorial the game has to offer actually pay attention to this or it will bite you in the  when you are actually playing once you get that over with youre probably going to say to yourself ok i think i get what i am doing let me play online matchmaking heres one simple answer for you no dota 2 requires a team effort and what i mean by a team effort is that if 1 person does something it will affect the team if 1 person does bad the team will take the toll of that 1 person so if you are going straight into matchmaking with almost no experience you are most likely going to die a lot get yelled at close the game and never come back trust me i should know because that was my first experience with dota 2 now what i do recommend you do is either practice by yourself or with friends in an offline bot match that way if you do bad you dont feel bad for perhaps costing the team the game not only is this better as you keep playing you will learn more and more about the game try and find someone that is experienced to help you understand the game and help you progress in skill for it once you feel that you are more knowledgeable about the game you can go ahead and do perhaps coop bot and then onto the traditional matchmaking where it is 5v5 team fights dota 2 is one my favorite games to date the fact that i have this gem another chance makes me lucky try to follow the tips i provided in this recommendation and i guarantee you that you will not be dissappointed with dota 2

recommended
a standard match of dota 2 features the strongholds of two opposing factions the radiant and the dire containing critical structures called ancients which are surrounded by a number of lesser buildings the bases of these two factions are connected by three main paths referred to as lanes which are guarded by defensive towers as well as autonomous units called creeps which periodically spawn in groups and traverse the lanes attacking enemy units or structures they encounter the dota 2 map is functionally symmetrical despite having a number of critical differences conferring a variety of advantages and disadvantages to each side the radiant is based at the southwest corner of the map while the dire is based at the northeast corner the two sides are divided by a river that runs perpendicular to the central lane the two teams typically composed of five players each are pitted against one another to compete as the defenders for their respective ancients[6] featured across the map are hostile units referred to as neutrals which are not aligned to either faction and are primarily located in the forests located on the northeast side of the river is a boss called roshan who typically requires multiple team members to kill and drops strategically powerful items

dota 2 you can love it hate it or both at the same time dota 2 is the reboot of the original dota game made in 2005 and is owned by the company valve dota 2 is a mmoba or massive multilayer online battle arena and the objective of the game is to be able to destroy the enemys ancient you do this by picking from the 112 unique heroes that are available for you for free for ever the game itself is similar to its predecessor as well as other mmobas but adds new mechanics as well as customization items for most of the heroes the game play is smooth and well refined all the heroes have there own unique play style and it fits well with the game dota 2 although it may not have mind blowing effects still manages to look astonishing as well as not stressing your computer too hard and if you dont like the way something looks you can change it valve introduces a cosmetic system that adds no benefits or hindrances to the game but it allows you to make the game the way you want whether you like cruel dire tide or crystallized manna there are cosmetics and other customization items for everyone the game also has a ranked system for more serious players who want to make it to a team replayability is a huge part of a game and dota 2 has it there are multiple game modes ranging from a random hero to drafting a whole team with this system it will take a while to be able to get board of dota 2 for a ranking all around i would have to give it a 9510 due to some minor flaws this is shown in ranked they need a way to measure the single person and not just the team as a whole this can lead to being trapped in low brackets

this game is without a doubt the freest free to game out there everything is free right off the bat and that makes a huge difference in gameplay there are no buffs that you can buy before the game that would have even the slightest impact on the match the only thing you pay for is cosmetic items which again have no effect on gameplay heroes are fun to play and range in difficutly so other charcters take more time and paicientce to master there is also a wide range of charcters types to play as so you never get bored from the ranged characters to the melee characters to the nukers to the tanks there will always be a fun and interesting character that fits your playstyle though dota 2 plays out similar to other mobas it is very diverse in its playstyles do not treat it like games like league of ledgends its a completly different game entireley and should be treated as such that being said the learning curve is very difficult and other players on dota are extremely unforgiving your first few games will be rough but after one good game or your first win its hard to step away from the computer and once you learned your prefered playstyle and find a character you enjoy dota 2 can be one of the most addicting games youve ever played dota 2 is one of the best games in the moba genre and for good reason gameplay is fun and challenging and there is a hero for everybody though it will take awhile for you to start getting the hang of things the rewards are well worth the time and effort
